summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing the Epstein investigation. It references a recent meeting with victims and plans to travel to Palm Beach for a proffer session with a co-conspirator, which is later canceled due to an anticipated hurricane.

persons.name: Duncan, Michele
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain regarding the Epstein investigation and travel plans.

events.title: Meeting with Victims
events.description: Prosecutors met with victims, who were grateful, and the meeting was helpful to the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Planned Travel for Proffer Session
events.description: Prosecutors planned to travel to Palm Beach to conduct a proffer session with a co-conspirator, flying in on Tuesday and out on Wednesday.

events.title: Trip Cancellation Due to Hurricane
events.description: The planned trip to Palm Beach for the proffer session was canceled due to an anticipated hurricane, with aims to rebook for later dates.

keyFacts: The email confirms an ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators as of August 2019.
Prosecutors successfully met with victims, who were described as 'very grateful,' indicating victim cooperation.
A proffer session with a co-conspirator was planned in Palm Beach, suggesting active negotiations or information gathering from associates.
The trip was canceled due to an anticipated hurricane, showing external factors impacting the investigation timeline.
The email chain involves internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding investigative steps.
